intro: Phalacrodiscus arvensis, commonly known as the field starwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along railway tracks. It blooms from late spring to early summer and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments. The species is also notable for its medicinal properties, having been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
